Now they want money for more - w/ ZERO negotiation on how $ is spent.

-Make health care a right
-Break up big banks
-Save the planet
-Make college tuition-free
-End endless wars
-Make the wealthy pay their fair share

RT @RoKhanna Since 1987 when adjusting for inflation, the % increase in:

➡️ Tuition costs at public universities : 183%
➡️ Tuition costs at private universities: 142%
➡️ Minimum wage: 20%
➡️ Early career salaries: 3%

This is student debt crisis in a nutshell.

“While the plan is technically universal, it really does seem geared toward alleviating the current burdens of the poor and lower-middle class.” #UniversalChildCare https://slate.com/business/2019/06/elizabeth-warren-child-care-plan-single-moms.html

Nearly half of all college students are going hungry and the average college senior takes on $30,000 in debt.
 
But let's go beyond statistics. Share your personal story in a video or tweet, with the hashtag #CollegeForAll. And tell me what we should be doing to fix this crisis.

It wasn’t until marriage equality became law that gay & lesbian couples could jointly file tax returns—so they paid more in taxes. Our government owes them more than $50M for the years our discriminatory tax code left them out. We must right these wrongs. https://www.mic.com/p/elizabeth-warrens-refund-equality-act-would-give-lgbtq-couples-the-tax-refunds-they-were-previously-denied-18022982

“What does it profit, my brethren, if someone says he has faith but does not have works?" I am grateful for this moment, and I will not let this blessing sit idle. My faith will not only be in my belief, it must also be in my actions. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/D9rs1nTXkAERfnc.jpg
It is true that the 1% have a lot of money and a lot of power. But 99% is a hell of a lot bigger number than 1%.

It is judged by how it treats children, the sick and the poor.

The Trump administration must stop obstructing this.  https://www.bustle.com/p/a-harriet-tubman-20-bill-design-exists-so-why-is-its-release-date-delayed-18006506

When the Supreme Court ruled on Olmstead v. L.C., they declared all Americans with disabilities deserve full inclusion in every community. Twenty years later, we still haven't made this a reality. As president, I will fight to do so. https://rewire.news/article/2019/06/19/disabled-people-have-had-the-legal-right-to-live-in-their-communities-for-20-years-but-thats-still-not-the-reality-for-many/

We are not going back. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1142488781351772167/pu/img/D4O_A6rG-6fGxB8r.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1142488781351772167/pu/vid/480x270/MHVZvgFURKu5N2i5.mp4?tag=10
